name: Delta Burnaby Hotel and Conference Centre

reviews.text: This hotel and conference centre is in a beautiful location with excellent amenities. We were there for a company hockey tournament and they were very good to us!
reviews.title: So Nice!

reviews.text: The casino is convient, food was delicious, room was very nice, staff were wonderful!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with some highway noise

reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again, and I would recommend all of my friends to stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Almost Flawless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am writing this review as i am still here in the hotel. In fact, I am using one of the hotel's two (2) computer terminals. I am using the one in the Signature Club Lounge (20th floor)'s computer, which has a printer attached. The other one is located on the main floor in the Business Centre. That particular one seems to be used all the time as the door to the Business Centre was left wide open and no login/ password is required, so anyone can walk in and use it.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is situated just south of the Transcanada highway 1 which has a lot of traffic all the time. We were placed on the 19th floor (Signature club) and that room had a view of the majestic mountains & the highway. The highway is noisy despite the hotel having heavy curtain & sheer, it couldn't completely drown out the noise. Though the view of the mountains is very breathtaking. Plus, you can walk outside to the balcony for a panaramic view.
reviews.title: Delta privilege program is a SCAM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel several times now since it was changed to a Delta hotel. There is a casino attached, which is a lot of fun. The restaurants serve excellent food - the live music on the weekends is hot. The rooms are very comfortable as are most of the Delta, and very quiet. The bed is so wonderful, I have asked for and received the details so I can get one myself. You can upgrade to the Signature floors (the top 2) and it includes appies from 4-7 with an honor bar (very good appies) and continental breakfast in the morning, with juice, great coffees, boiled eggs, cereals, cheese, muffins, toast, etc., plus newspapers and an excellent view of the city. Front desk staff are all very pleasant and friendly, parking for hotel guests is free. There is a parking garage on site where you can leave your car for a few days for free if you are taking a trip.
reviews.title: very inviting and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the good: Free parking, if you park in the casino garage. Easy to get to by car (Take the TransCan via 15th Ave at Pacific Crossing in Blaine at the border---not the Peace Arch Crossing---if you're coming from the US: Google's default route is shorter but harder to folllow). Clean. Windows that open. A decent ATM in the casino (but bank ATMs are still cheaper to convert US dollars). Excellent service: We needed a few amenities like a corkscrew, and there was no problem. OK gym and outdoor hot-tub. Free Globe & Mail newspaper in the morning---an excellent choice for a paper junkie like me, but might not be relevant for someone touring Vancouver. Starbucks in the lobby.
reviews.title: Decent hotel if you have a car or want to walk to a bus or train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, the bad. The showerhead didn't appear to be conservation-efficient. The hotel's location is in the middle of a suburban sprawl, except the closest restaurant outside the hotel is a McDonalds about a 1/3-mile away. There are two SkyTrain stations about 3/4-mile away, but the walking route is along a boring highway; a bus that goes to the station is a short, boring walk. This is not a city environment; Burnaby is like an upscale Terre Haute: There's no "there" there, unless you're really into American-style malls. There's no apparent way to turn off the loud music piped into the gym, so to watch the TV requires the volume to be very loud. The amenities shop is the worst I've ever seen, and the Starbucks in the lobby has absolutely nothing healthy---just awful-looking greasy pastry, no rolls, not even cookies. The so-called business center appeared to be two computers that you have to pay for; they're located in the convenience store.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, great rooms!
The Best Hotel I've Never Stayed at!!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Delta Burnaby in August of 2009. This is by far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.

The decor in the hotel is gorgeous, the beds are incredibly comfortable and the restaurant is absolutely exquisite. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and extremely accommodating. While my boyfriend and I were in the lounge section in the restaurant we were greeted by a staff member who actually sat down with us for about 15 minutes to tell us about the nightlife, entertainment and dining in the downtown Vancouver area. My boyfriend and the staff member really hit it off and we ended up getting complimentary drinks. As well, we called down to the bell desk on the first day there and my boyfriend asked the bellman to give us complimentary internet, and he didn't even hesitate to give it to us. It was such a great stay!
reviews.title: So visually attractive but somewhat too sterile

reviews.text: Stayed at the Delta for 5 nights and had a great stay. The standard room does not come with a fridge and when I requested one at check-in the staff delivered and set one up in 30 minutes at no charge. The hotel has parking for $15 per day and since the free casino parkade height was too low for my truck I stay underground and was pleased with the amount of free space and had no concerns about theft or door dings. BCIT is only 2 blocks away so it is a great location for this or if you want to enjoy a hotel with a casino in the lower mainland. The rooms were spacious, clean and quiet with only a few rooms on each floor which kept the noise at night to a minimum if you were lucky enough to be a quiet floor. For food there is an A&W and a Chinese buffet (Jade) in the casino for quick food at a low price. The hotel also has a lounge and restuarant to enjoy or have room service after a long day. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, Subway is about 4 blocks up Canada Way, Metrotown Mall (5 min drive), and across Highway 1 (3 min drive) you will find may restuarants including White Spot, BP, and a Shark Club. If you have kids they may have limited entertainment at the hotel. Internet is extra unless you upgrade your room. The staff were very friendly and helpful and I would recommend this hotel at anyone
reviews.title: Great Stay :0)

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 3 day business stay at the Delta Burnaby Hotel. It was my first time at the Hotel and I was very impressed with the lobby and the service at the front desk. There were several people at the desk yet I was served with only a moments wait. The staff was efficient friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great staff, good service

reviews.text: I got a room on the Signature Floor. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was to die for. It was very comfortable. The only down side, the toilet kept running a couple of times.
reviews.title: The recent remodeling makes for a relaxing, elegant stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house cleaning staff kept the room spotless and even left a nice note.
reviews.title: We were treated royally at this beautiful hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quiet and I got a good night sleep. The view from the room is not very exciting because the hotel is kind of out of the way and all you saw was industrial parks and freeway. However the hotel is attached to a casino and I did enjoy that..
reviews.title: Bad Service !

reviews.text: We often go to Vancouver to visit family and this hotel is convenient and comfortable.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.text: It has only recently become a Delta Hotel and they are in the process of refurbishing. We have stayed there twice and each time the room has been newly decorated and very bright and cheerful. New air conditioning units ensure a comfortable temperature and are very quiet. The restaurant is reasonably priced and has good food. We were not tempted to try the casino but if you are a player, then you would find staying here very convenient.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel with a free shuttle

reviews.text: Great service, and offers a free shuttle around Burnaby. Very convenient and reasonably priced. Clean.
reviews.title: not four star or 3 star, really 2.5 from seasoned travelller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just walk in to elevator, worn carpets and dirty, rooms need major overhaul.
reviews.title: Very nice modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Management reaction to complaints poor.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Staff

description: Welcome to the new Delta Burnaby Hotel and Conference Centre, conveniently located close to business centres, leading academic institutions, shopping malls and attractions. The hotel will welcome the business traveller with the comforts of home and office. The leisure traveller will enjoy nearby shopping excursions, Burnaby's famous parks and local attractions. The hotel is located 30 minutes from Vancouver International Airport, and 15 minutes from downtown Vancouver by Skytrain or Highway route.
